nodes.caption: Nutrition Sensitive Intervention Program: 1. Hope Family Program (PKH) 2. Sustainable Food Program (P2L)/ Sustainable Food Home Area (KRPL) 3. Bantuan Pangan Non Tunai (BPNT) 4. Family Counseling under five years 5. Parenting Class 6. Holistic Early Care and Children Education 7. Proper Sanitation 8. Healthy Drinking Water
Macro Determinants: A. Socio-economic 1. Level of Education 2. Income Level 3. National Health Insurance (JKN)/Jamkesda B. Socio-cultural "Religious Leaders"

Nutrition Specific Intervention Program: 1. Pregnant women with chronic energy deficiency are given additional food 2. Children under five years of malnutrition are given supplementary food 3. Pregnant women are given Fe tablets 4. Adolescent girls are given vitamin A 5. Children under five years are given vitamin A 6. Pregnant women have their fourth month of pregnancy check-up 7. Complete basic immunization 8. Posyandu visits 9. Postpartum mother service
Food Access: 1. Animal/Vegetable food production 2. Food Insecurity Area
Mother's Parenting: 1. Exclusive Breastfeeding 2. Supplementary Breastfeeding
Healthcare Access: 1. Ownership of KIA Book 2. Access to Health Center 3. Number of Health Facilities 4. Number of Health Care Workers
Nutritional Intake: Proportion of Consumption of Meat/Rice/Bulbs/ Vegetables/Fruits
Infectious Disease: 1. Diarrhea 2. Acute respiratory infections (ARI) 3. Lung Tuberculosis 4. Malaria
Pregnant Women Nutritional Status: 1. Chronic energy deficiency in pregnant women 2. Anemia in pregnant women
Impact: 1. Low Birth Weight (LBW) 2. Short Birth Length (SBL)
